intro: Acaena macropoda, commonly known as the New Zealand spinach or mountain spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its dense, spiny growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into spherical, woody fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are edible and have a spinach-like flavor, making it a traditional food source for Māori. Acaena macropoda thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas and along streambanks.
